title: Firefox and Chrome crash instantly when opened on Windows 10
content: Hey, I just factory reset my computer and the first thing I did was download Firefox and Google Chrome. When I try to open them, they instantly close. The browser that I'm currently able to use is Microsoft Edge. After this didn't work, I checked for Windows updates, and had some queued. After restarting and applying the updates, the issue persisted. Although it might be worth to mention that after a few moments from restarting my laptop, they both worked fine. But given like ten-ish seconds, they both started to crash again.
creator: i.masterofskills

title: Keep getting "connection not secure" on Washington Post site
content: In the last couple of days I have been unable to view comments or open some (not all) articles on Washington Post. I am logged into the site correctly. I have disabled all of the Firefox extensions, used the troubleshooter, cleared the cache and cookies, and refreshed Firefox yet nothing seems to work. I also opened the site in private browser mode. Everything worked on the home page, but when I tried to view a specific page (in this case the crosswords, of all things), the problem continued. I've clicked on the little padlock for the WP home page and on the "connection not secure" page and both say there is no security problem. What is going on? How can I fix this? I can live without reading WaPo, but the problem is just driving me nuts.
creator: clslagle00

title: Retrieving history of links/sessions from firefox
content:
Hello,

I recently updated my Firefox and it cleaned out my entire history of websites I have visited along with sessions I had open. Utilizing the "Restore previous sessions" tab doesn't have anything in it, so am wondering if their is a backup file of websites/sessions that I could load that might have been created (I'm on a Macbook). Would love some advice on this - thanks!

title: Can't Open Browser
content: This problem started yesterday. Right after turning on the computer (Windows 10), if I try to start Firefox (or other browsers based on it), I get a message saying "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." Of course, since I just started the computer, no old process is running. I've looked in Resource Monitor and Task Manager to be sure. If I click on "Close Firefox" I just get the same message again. I installed the latest version of Firefox. I deleted one of the other browsers and reinstalled it. I've tried doing a clean boot. Nothing helps. Meanwhile, I can still open browsers not based on Mozilla.

title: bookmarks
content: Today I did what I thought was a clean install? Not sure if that worked frankly. I lost all my bookmarks and settings when that happened. I was able to recover most the bookmarks from the another browser option. Thank god! But now when I access my bookmarks from the menu tab, my bookmarks don't' appear any longer? The list that used to appear no longer appears? What appears when I access my bookmark tab is a small box that says Manage Bookmarks, Edit Bookmarks, Bookmark Toolbar, Other Bookmarks and Mozilla Firefox. How do I get back my bookmark list that I used to have and my bookmarks in the order they were???? I have many bookmarks so my bookmarks are important! Can someone please explain how I get back my bookmark list that I had before I made the change? Thank you.

title: Scroll wheel on mouse stopped working. Only way to scroll is to press Ctrl+Shift and then use scroll wheel.

But i would prefer to not have to press down Ctrl+Shift to scroll. This problem is only happening on Firefox and no other browser or program on my computer. Do you know any solutions?

title: Invalid Hex String:Null Error When Using Recovery Key
content: Hi, I'm trying to recover my FF account using the recovery key. I used Google Authenticator for 2FA, reset the phone, found out GA doesn't back 2FA accounts up remotely. That was a few years ago; I gave up and went back to Chrome. Trying again to regain access to my FF account now, if possible. I don't have the backup codes, but I do have the 32 character recovery code, but I'm getting this error (screenshot) trying to use it. I tried the key with spaces (8 4-character blocks) and without, got the error both times. What am I doing wrong here?
